name: StudyBuddy
description: AI-powered study companion app that helps college students organize notes, generate flashcards, and track study sessions with smart reminders.

problem.statement: College students struggle to organize scattered notes across multiple courses, create effective study materials, and maintain consistent study habits. Most end up cramming before exams because they lack a structured review system.
problem.impact: Poor study habits lead to lower grades, increased stress and anxiety, and wasted time re-reading notes instead of actively recalling. Studies show 70% of students feel underprepared for exams despite spending hours studying.
problem.currentSolution: Students currently use a mix of Google Docs, Notion, Anki, and paper notes. This scattered approach means context-switching between apps, no unified progress tracking, and manual flashcard creation that takes hours.

personas.name: Stressed Sam
painPoints: Notes are scattered across Google Docs, Notion, and paper
Spends 2+ hours making flashcards manually every week
Forgets to review until the night before exams
Can't tell which topics need the most revision
goals: Have all notes in one searchable place
Get smart reminders for spaced repetition
See a clear dashboard of study progress per course

personas.name: Organized Priya
painPoints: Limited study time due to work schedule
Hard to prioritize which subjects need attention
Existing apps are too complex or too simple
No way to share study materials with classmates easily
goals: Maximize study efficiency in short time blocks
AI-suggested study priorities based on upcoming exams
Simple, clean UI that doesn't waste time

competitors.name: Anki
gaps: Steep learning curve for new users

competitors.name: Notion
strengths: Flexible and powerful for any workflow
gaps: No built-in flashcard or quiz system
No study-specific features like spaced repetition

features.name: Smart Note Editor
features.description: Rich text editor with markdown support, code blocks, LaTeX math, and image paste. Notes are organized by course/subject.

features.name: AI Flashcard Generator
features.description: Select any note section and auto-generate flashcards using AI. Supports Q&A, fill-in-the-blank, and multiple choice formats.

features.name: Spaced Repetition Engine
features.description: SM-2 algorithm that schedules card reviews at optimal intervals. Shows due cards count per deck on dashboard.

features.name: Study Dashboard
features.description: Overview of all courses, upcoming exams, cards due for review, study streaks, and weekly study time chart.

features.name: Pomodoro Study Timer
features.description: Built-in 25/5 Pomodoro timer with session logging. Tracks total study time per course.

features.name: Course Management
features.description: Create courses with name, color, professor, schedule. Set exam dates for smart priority suggestions.

features.name: Full-Text Search
features.description: Search across all notes and flashcards instantly. Filter by course, date, or tag.

features.name: Deck Sharing
features.description: Export flashcard decks as links or JSON. Import shared decks from classmates.

features.name: AI Practice Quizzes
features.description: AI generates timed practice quizzes from your notes with answers and explanations.

features.name: Study Groups
features.description: Create shared study rooms where friends can see each other's progress and share materials.

decisions.title: Which rich text editor to use?
decisions.reasoning: Tiptap has the best DX, excellent docs, built-in extensions for code blocks and math, and great community. Slate is too low-level. Lexical is powerful but overkill. BlockNote is nice but less mature.

decisions.title: Spaced repetition algorithm?
decisions.reasoning: SM-2 is battle-tested, well-documented, and simple to implement. FSRS is better but more complex to get right. We can always upgrade later. Leitner is too simplistic for serious use.

decisions.title: AI provider for flashcard generation?
decisions.reasoning: Groq offers free tier with fast inference. Student budget means we need free. OpenAI is expensive. Ollama requires local GPU. Gemini is an option but Groq's speed is unmatched.

decisions.title: State management approach?
decisions.reasoning: Zustand is minimal, fast, and perfect for client state. TanStack Query handles server state. No need for Redux complexity or Context prop drilling.
